text:
SUSE Linux 9.x (2.6.5.xx), with apache 2.0.49 and 2.0.54 both fail to list files
in the directory if they are over approximatly 1gb, I have a 1.2gb and 2.4gb
file that dependent on there order of list fail to list in in autoindex list.
And this stops any file after this file from listing.

If I break the file into parts it is ok, or remove it from the directory it
lists all files (bar this one).
creator: davecolvin@hotmail.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
With 2.0.51 or later, the autoindex listing will not be truncated if a large
file is encountered.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 17357 ***

It appears that this is not fully resolved. With apache 2.0.54, there is no
longer truncation of the files following the large file, however, the large file
itself is not listed. I have a 2.3 GB file that shows this behavior.
creator: bg_sudhakar@yahoo.com
rpluem@apache.org
text:
I think(In reply to comment #2)
> It appears that this is not fully resolved. With apache 2.0.54, there is no
> longer truncation of the files following the large file, however, the large file
> itself is not listed. I have a 2.3 GB file that shows this behavior.

I think that this is correct since 2.0.x has no large file support (LFS), so

1. You would not be able to download this file.
2. I think that stating this file (and thus displaying its size) does not work
   correctly without LFS.

Please report back if the behaviour you describe is true for 2.2.x.
